sentences.japanese: 探していた鍵がやっと見当たった。
sentences.english: The key I was looking for was finally found.

sentences.japanese: 良いアイデアが見当たらない。
sentences.english: I can't find a good idea.

sentences.japanese: 学校から帰ったら、自分の部屋で自由に遊びたい。
sentences.english: After coming home from school, I want to play freely in my room.

sentences.japanese: この町には規則がない！完全な自由だ！ everyone, let's dance!
sentences.english: This town has no rules! It's complete freedom! Everyone, let's dance!

sentences.japanese: この二つのペンを(色)で見分けてください。
sentences.english: Please distinguish these two pens by color.

sentences.japanese: 今日の昼ごはん、牛肉と豚肉どちらが(味)で見分けられますか？
sentences.english: Today's lunch, can you tell the difference between beef and pork by taste?

sentences.japanese: 図書館で面白い本をみつけました。
sentences.english: I found an interesting book at the library.

sentences.japanese: 迷子の子供をみつけて、涙が止まらなかったです。
sentences.english: When I found a lost child, I couldn't stop crying.

sentences.japanese: 直前(ちょくぜん)に、スマホを落としたので、画面が割れました。
sentences.english: I just dropped my smartphone right before, so the screen cracked!

sentences.japanese: 直前(ちょくぜん)に、レストランの予約を確認しましたか？
sentences.english: Did you check your reservation at the restaurant just now?

sentences.japanese: 試験の直前(ちょくぜん)、友達から「頑張って！」とメッセージをもらったら、突然、猫が机に飛び乗ってきて、全然集中できませんでした。
sentences.english: Right before the exam, my friend sent me a message saying "Do your best!", but then suddenly a cat jumped onto my desk and I couldn't concentrate at all!

sentences.japanese: 深夜に、静かに家へ帰りました。
sentences.english: I quietly returned home late at night.

sentences.japanese: なぜ深夜の公園で泣いているのか？ あなたの恋人と別れたのですか？
sentences.english: Why are you crying in the park so late at night? Did you break up with your lover?

sentences.japanese: 私は子どもを育てるのが大好きです。
sentences.english: I love bringing up children.

sentences.japanese: この犬は私に育ててもらって、世界一強くなりたいです！
sentences.english: This dog wants me to bring it up so that it can become the strongest in the world!

sentences.japanese: 今日の外来 (がいらい) は10時から始まります。
sentences.english: Today's outpatient clinic starts at 10 AM.

sentences.japanese: 外来 (がいらい) の待ち時間は長かったけど、 finally 医者 (いしゃ) に見てもらえてホッとした！
sentences.english: The waiting time in the outpatient clinic was long, but I finally got to see a doctor and felt relieved!

sentences.japanese: 今、テーブルに椅子を立てています。
sentences.english: I'm standing chairs up on the table now.

sentences.japanese: この映画では、巨大なロボットが町を立てた！ everyone is in shock!
sentences.english: In this movie, a giant robot stood up (the town) and everyone was shocked!

sentences.japanese: 夜空に海王星が見えます。
sentences.english: Neptune can be seen in the night sky.

sentences.japanese: 海王星が地球を襲う日、私たちは準備ができているか？
sentences.english: When Neptune attacks Earth, will we be prepared?

sentences.japanese: 今日、図書館に行って本を調べます。
sentences.english: Today, I will go to the library and investigate books.

sentences.japanese: この謎(なぞ)の食べ物は何(なん)なのか、命がけで調べます！
sentences.english: I will investigate this mysterious food with my life on the line!

sentences.japanese: 線路の近くに住んでいると、電車がよく通るので便利です。
sentences.english: Living near railroad tracks is convenient because trains often pass by.

sentences.japanese: 線路から飛び出した猫が、突如として電車に乗り込んだら、誰もが驚くでしょう !
sentences.english: If a cat that jumped out from the railroad track suddenly got on a train, everyone would be surprised!

sentences.japanese: 道に直線の白い線が引いてあります。
sentences.english: There are straight white lines drawn on the road.

sentences.japanese: 今、私たちの愛は直線ではなく曲線だ！(曲線 means curve)
sentences.english: Now, our love is not a straight line but a curve!

sentences.japanese: 友好な関係を築くために、相手の意見にも興味を持ちましょう。
sentences.english: To build a friendly relationship, try to be interested in others' opinions as well.

sentences.japanese: 今日の試合で、チームはとても友好な態度を見せましたが、結果は0対9の大敗だった！
sentences.english: The team showed very friendly attitudes today's game, but the result was a humiliating 0-9 loss!

sentences.japanese: 来年、新しい目標を設定するつもりです。
sentences.english: Next year, I plan to set a new goal.

sentences.japanese: 今日の目標は、一週間で日本語が上手になれることだ！でも、 probably not...
sentences.english: Today's goal is to become good at Japanese in a week! But probably not...

sentences.japanese: 仕事で困っていたら、同僚が協力してくれました。
sentences.english: When I was stuck at work, my coworker helped me out.

sentences.japanese: このゲームでは、友達と協力してドラゴンを倒さないといけません！でも、 частенько我が家の猫ちゃんが「協力」って言うのが面白いです。
sentences.english: In this game, you must cooperate with your friends to defeat the dragon! But my family cat often says "cooperation" (きょうりょく) in a funny way.

sentences.japanese: このバッグの(格好)が気に入った。
sentences.english: I like the shape of this bag.

sentences.japanese: そのネコは、月光の中、とても(格好)よく見えた。
sentences.english: That cat looked very stylish in the moonlight.

sentences.japanese: 彼は不法な駐車をして、警察に捕まった。
sentences.english: He was arrested for illegal parking.

sentences.japanese: 不法な魔法使いが街中でダンスパーティーを開いている！誰か止めてください！
sentences.english: An illegal sorcerer is holding a dance party in the middle of town! Please, someone stop him!

sentences.japanese: 彼は政治の問題で(ほしゅてきな)考え方をすることが多いです。
sentences.english: He tends to have conservative views on political issues.

sentences.japanese: あの人、保守的すぎて、iPhoneも使ってないんです！スマホの時代に、まだiPod使ってるんだもん…
sentences.english: That person is so conservative, they don’t even use iPhones! In the smartphone era, they’re still using an iPod…

sentences.japanese: あなたの意見に同感(どうかん)します。
sentences.english: I agree with your opinion.

sentences.japanese: このパーティーがつまらないと gesagt? 同感です！全員でバンジージャンプに行きましょう！
sentences.english: You said this party is boring? Me too! Let's all go bungee jumping!
